DataElement.preferredName: Liver Size Centimeter Below Costal Arch Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The centimeter measurement of the liver size below costal margin.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the size of a patient's or subject's liver.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The largest gland of the body, lying beneath the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium and upper part of the epigastrium; it is of irregular shape and weighs from 1 to 2 kg, or about 1/40 the weight of the body. It secretes the bile and is also of great importance in both carbohydrate and protein metabolism. SYN hepar.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

Property.preferredDefinition: Size; the physical magnitude of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch._In a place or position that is lower._The medial margin of the lower opening of the chest wall.  It is formed by the seventh to tenth ribs._Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.:In a place or position that is lower.:The medial margin of the thorax created by the seventh to tenth rib.:Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Concepts.definition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
In a place or position that is lower.
The medial margin of the thorax created by the seventh to tenth rib.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
